text: When will be Python 3.x ready for serious production?
I'm thinking mainly in web apps.

I have been programming with the 3.x using only the "batteries included" and all works just fine, but I am forced to go back to 2.x when I have to make any serious work in the web (eg, django and/or google app engine).
I am primarily interested in these, but my question is more general... when will I be able to discard 2.x for new projects?
Should I wait months?, years?, how many?
Is the transition going well, or are the "big guys" neglecting this new version?
